feed.title: Radiocarbon in the Earth System 2017
feed.subtitle: Information and resources about the short course Radiocarbon in the Earth System 2017

entry.title: Paleo environments and modeling
entry.content: We will have lectures on paleo applications, and a lab on reservoir modeling.
entry.summary: We will have lectures on paleo applications, and a lab on reservoir modeling.

entry.title: The ocean system
entry.content: Brett Walker will give a lecture on the ocean. There will be a lecture on modeling radiocarbon in reservoir systems.
entry.summary: Brett Walker will give a lecture on the ocean. There will be a lecture on modeling radiocarbon in reservoir systems.

entry.title: The atmosphere system
entry.content: Heather Graven will join us today for two lectures on atmospheric radiocarbon
entry.summary: Heather Graven will join us today for two lectures on atmospheric radiocarbon

entry.title: The land system
entry.summary: Today we will study terrestrial ecosystems.

entry.title: Radiocarbon and the global C cycle

link.title: Radiocarbon and the global C cycle

entry.content: On the first day of the course we will learn about basic concepts of radiocarbon and earth system science, in particularthe global carbon cycle, how to report radicarbon measurements, how to date organic material, and applications for tree-ring research.
entry.summary: On the first day of the course we will learn about basic concepts of radiocarbon and earth system science, in particularthe global carbon cycle, how to report radicarbon measurements, how to date organic material, and applications for tree-ring research.

entry.title: Get together
entry.content: We will start the course with an information meeting to get to know each other better. We will meet at a local pub/restaurant at 17:00. More details to come.
entry.summary: We will start the course with an information meeting to get to know each other better. We will meet at a local pub/restaurant at 17:00. More details to come.
